DOC.brief_summary: Health -E-You interactive , individually tailor computer application ( App ) develop educate adolescent girl contraceptive method assist select contraceptive method meet individual need . The goal reduce disparity unintended pregnancy rate among Hispanic adolescent female . The App design close collaboration clinician Hispanic adolescent . Health-E You design use conjunction clinical encounter prime patient provider prior face-to-face visit facilitate discussion provision appropriate contraception . It found key principle Social Cognitive Theory . Through interactive approach , Health-E-You assess user ' sexual health risk , knowledge contraceptive use history preference facilitate sense agency self-efficacy around select effective contraceptive method . First , user selects prefer language ( English Spanish ) accord select language , App provide brief description module consent user participate . It assess sexual health knowledge use interactive truth vs. myth game . Correct answer truth vs. myth statement present user short , easy-to-read explanation . Next , App assess user 's individual contraceptive need preference . The user also screen possible medical contraindication contraceptive method . Based user 's input , App provide individually tailor messaging recommendation contraceptive method accord user 's timeline childbearing lifestyle preference , past experience need . The recommendation present visual continuum effective contraceptive option base desired duration action efficacy . Users option learn recommend method ( ) also option learn contraceptive option . Evidence-based contraceptive information present user-friendly format include YouTube style video . Users select view brief video vignettes feature clinician provide additional information method interest and/or video diverse young woman discuss experience contraceptive method . At end App , adolescent ask select method ( ) interest use . They also encourage use condom protect sexually transmit infection ( STIs ) provide information emergency contraception . Users review summary key information gather App offer opportunity share information clinician clinician well support adolescent select use effective appropriate contraceptive method . The objective study evaluate effectiveness Health-E You ability address disparity contraceptive knowledge , access utilization among Hispanic adolescent . The long term goal reduce incidence unprotected sexual intercourse ( associate unintended pregnancy STIs ) time . A total 14 School-Based Health Centers ( SBHCs ) affiliate Los Angeles Unified School District , randomize , equal chance , use Health-E You App provide usual care ( without App ) . A total 1400 Hispanic adolescent select participate study ( 700 intervention clinic 700 control clinic ) . The investigator hypothesize adolescent use Health-E You App great sexual health knowledge likely use effective contraceptive adolescent use App . The investigator also evaluate effectiveness App ability improve effectiveness efficiency health visit . Participants ask complete follow-up survey immediately follow clinical encounter three six month clinical encounter . The ultimate goal study address health disparity use effective contraceptive ultimately reduce incidence unintended pregnancy STIs among at-risk Hispanic adolescent girl .
DOC.brief_title: Health-E You : Reducing Unintended Pregnancies Among Hispanic Adolescents
DOC.criteria: Female 1418 year age Hispanic/Latina English Spanishspeaker Has sexual intercourse Currently pregnant Currently use intrauterine device implant contraceptive method Male Under 14 19 year age Not sexually active NonHispanic / Latina
